result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan J. Tijerina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug . 
++ Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
++ Pay restitution plus surcharges.  May Not have contact with victims of any of his crimes.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments made.  Atty Graveley requests the prior cash bond be reinstated and not forfeited.  Upon hearing statements motion is granted and prior cash bond will not be forfeited.  Restitution is ordered in the amount of $3132.00 as stipulated to by parties.  Defendant is sentenced to 7 years in the WSP; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years of Extended Supervision with conditions.  Credit for 245 days.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given on record and Appeal Rights given and signed.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Matt Perz. Clerk LE. Comm. Mason discloses knowledge of def.'s parents, but does not recuse himself. No objection by either party to Comm. Mason presiding over preliminary hearing. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Burgoyne. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. KPD Det. Keith Dumesic sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Perz. Probable cause found. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 12-19-14 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 1-7-15 @ 8:45am. Bond continued.
filed by Atty Perz
Atty Mattew Perz
